verses.verse: Then Shephatiah<WH8203> the son<WH1121> of Mattan<WH4977>, and Gedaliah<WH1436> the son<WH1121> of Pashur<WH6583>, and Jucal<WH3116> the son<WH1121> of Shelemiah<WH8018>, and Pashur<WH6583> the son<WH1121> of Malchiah<WH4441>, heard<WH8085> the words<WH1697> that Jeremiah<WH3414> had spoken<WH1696> unto all the people<WH5971>, saying<WH559>,

Thus says<WH559> the Lord<WH3068>, He that remains<WH3427> in this city<WH5892> shall die<WH4191> by the sword<WH2719>, by the famine<WH7458>, and by the pestilence<WH1698>: but he that goes forth<WH3318> to the Chaldeans<WH3778> shall live<WH2421>; for he shall have his life<WH5315> for a prey<WH7998>, and shall live<WH2421>.
Thus says<WH559> the Lord<WH3068>, This city<WH5892> shall surely<WH5414> be given<WH5414> into the hand<WH3027> of the king<WH4428> of Babylon<WH894>'s army<WH2428>, which shall take it<WH3920>.

Therefore the princes<WH8269> said<WH559> unto the king<WH4428>, We beg you<WH376>, let this man be put to death<WH4191>: for thus<WH3651> he weakens<WH7503> the hands<WH3027> of the men<WH582> of war<WH4421> that remain<WH7604> in this city<WH5892>, and the hands<WH3027> of all the people<WH5971>, in speaking<WH1696> such words<WH1697> unto them<WH376>: for this man seeks<WH1875> not the welfare<WH7965> of this people<WH5971>, but the hurt<WH7451>.
Then Zedekiah<WH6667> the king<WH4428> said<WH559>, Behold<WH3027>, he is in your hand: for the king<WH4428> is not he that can<WH3201> do any thing against you<WH1697>.

Then took<WH3947> they Jeremiah<WH3414>, and cast<WH7993> him into the dungeon<WH953> of Malchiah<WH4441> the son<WH1121> of Hammelech<WH4428>, that was in the court<WH2691> of the prison<WH4307>: and they let down<WH7971> Jeremiah<WH3414> with cords<WH2256>. And in the dungeon<WH953> there was no water<WH4325>, but mire<WH2916>: so Jeremiah<WH3414> sunk<WH2883> in the mire<WH2916>.

Now when Ebed<WH5663>–melech the Ethiopian<WH3569>, one<WH376> of the eunuchs<WH5631> which was in the king<WH4428>'s house<WH1004>, heard<WH8085> that they had put<WH5414> Jeremiah<WH3414> in the dungeon<WH953>; the king<WH4428> then sitting<WH3427> in the gate<WH8179> of Benjamin<WH1144>;
Ebed<WH5663>–melech went forth<WH3318> out of the king<WH4428>'s house<WH1004>, and spoke<WH1696> to the king<WH4428>, saying<WH559>,

My lord<WH113> the king<WH4428>, these men<WH582> have done evil<WH7489> in all that they have done<WH6213> to Jeremiah<WH3414> the prophet<WH5030>, whom they have cast<WH7993> into the dungeon<WH953>; and he is like to die<WH4191> for<WH6440> hunger<WH7458> in the place<WH8478> where he is<WH3899>: for there is no more bread in the city<WH5892>.

Then the king<WH4428> commanded<WH6680> Ebed<WH5663>–melech the Ethiopian<WH3569>, saying<WH559>, Take<WH3947> from here thirty<WH7970> men<WH582> with you<WH3027>, and take up<WH5927> Jeremiah<WH3414> the prophet<WH5030> out of the dungeon<WH953>, before he die<WH4191>.

So Ebed<WH5663>–melech took<WH3947> the men<WH582> with him<WH3027>, and went<WH935> into the house<WH1004> of the king<WH4428> under the treasury<WH214>, and took<WH3947> there old<WH1094> cast rags<WH5499> and old<WH1094> rotten garments<WH4418>, and let them down<WH7971> by cords<WH2256> into the dungeon<WH953> to Jeremiah<WH3414>.

And Ebed<WH5663>–melech the Ethiopian<WH3569> said<WH559> unto Jeremiah<WH3414>, Put<WH7760> now these old<WH1094> cast rags<WH5499> and rotten garments<WH4418> under your armholes<WH679> under the cords<WH2256>. And Jeremiah<WH3414> did so<WH6213>.
So they drew up<WH4900> Jeremiah<WH3414> with cords<WH2256>, and took him up<WH5927> out of the dungeon<WH953>: and Jeremiah<WH3414> remained<WH3427> in the court<WH2691> of the prison<WH4307>.

Then Zedekiah<WH6667> the king<WH4428> sent<WH7971>, and took<WH3947> Jeremiah<WH3414> the prophet<WH5030> unto him into the third<WH7992> entry<WH3996> that is in the house<WH1004> of the Lord<WH3068>: and the king<WH4428> said<WH559> unto Jeremiah<WH3414>, I will ask<WH7592> you a thing<WH1697>; hide nothing from me<WH3582>.

Then Jeremiah<WH3414> said<WH559> unto Zedekiah<WH6667>, If I declare<WH5046> it unto you<WH4191>, will you not surely put me to death<WH4191>? and if I give you counsel<WH3289>, will you not listen unto me<WH8085>?

So Zedekiah<WH6667> the king<WH4428> swore<WH7650> secretly<WH5643> unto Jeremiah<WH3414>, saying<WH559>, As the Lord<WH3068> lives<WH2416>, that made<WH6213> us this soul<WH5315>, I will not put you to death<WH4191>, neither will I give<WH5414> you into the hand<WH3027> of these men<WH582> that seek<WH1245> your life<WH5315>.

Then said<WH559> Jeremiah<WH3414> unto Zedekiah<WH6667>, Thus says<WH559> the Lord<WH3068>, the God<WH430> of hosts<WH6635>, the God<WH430> of Israel<WH3478>; If you will assuredly<WH3318> go forth<WH3318> unto the king<WH4428> of Babylon<WH894>'s princes<WH8269>, then your soul<WH5315> shall live<WH2421>, and this city<WH5892> shall not be burned<WH8313> with fire<WH784>; and you shall live<WH2421>, and your house<WH1004>:

But if you will not go forth<WH3318> to the king<WH4428> of Babylon<WH894>'s princes<WH8269>, then shall this city<WH5892> be given<WH5414> into the hand<WH3027> of the Chaldeans<WH3778>, and they shall burn<WH8313> it with fire<WH784>, and you shall not escape out<WH4422> of their hand<WH3027>.

And Zedekiah<WH6667> the king<WH4428> said<WH559> unto Jeremiah<WH3414>, I am afraid<WH1672> of the Jews<WH3064> that are fallen<WH5307> to the Chaldeans<WH3778>, lest they deliver<WH5414> me into their hand<WH3027>, and they mock me<WH5953>.

But Jeremiah<WH3414> said<WH559>, They shall not deliver<WH5414> you<WH8085>. Obey, I beg you<WH6963>, the voice of the Lord<WH3068>, which I speak<WH1696> unto you<WH3190>: so it shall be well unto you<WH5315>, and your soul shall live<WH2421>.
But if you refuse<WH3986> to go forth<WH3318>, this is the word<WH1697> that the Lord<WH3068> has showed me<WH7200>:

And<WH802>, behold, all the women that are left<WH7604> in the king<WH4428> of Judah<WH3063>'s house<WH1004> shall be brought forth<WH3318> to the king<WH4428> of Babylon<WH894>'s princes<WH8269>, and those women shall say<WH559>, Your friends<WH582> have set you on<WH5496>, and have prevailed<WH3201> against you<WH7272>: your feet are sunk<WH2883> in the mire<WH1206>, and they are turned away<WH5472> back<WH268>.

So they shall bring out<WH3318> all your wives<WH802> and your sons<WH1121> to the Chaldeans<WH3778>: and you shall not escape out<WH4422> of their hand<WH3027>, but shall be taken<WH8610> by the hand<WH3027> of the king<WH4428> of Babylon<WH894>: and you shall cause this city<WH5892> to be burned<WH8313> with fire<WH784>.
Then said<WH559> Zedekiah<WH6667> unto Jeremiah<WH3414>, Let no man<WH376> know<WH3045> of these words<WH1697>, and you shall not die<WH4191>.

But if the princes<WH8269> hear<WH8085> that I have talked<WH1696> with you<WH935>, and they come unto you<WH559>, and say unto you<WH5046>, Declare unto us now what you have said<WH1696> unto the king<WH4428>, hide<WH3582> it not from us<WH4191>, and we will not put you to death; also what the king<WH4428> said unto you<WH1696>:

Then you shall say<WH559> unto them<WH5307>, I presented my supplication<WH8467> before<WH6440> the king<WH4428>, that he would not cause me to return<WH7725> to Jonathan<WH3083>'s house<WH1004>, to die there<WH4191>.

Then came<WH935> all the princes<WH8269> unto Jeremiah<WH3414>, and asked<WH7592> him<WH5046>: and he told them according to all these words<WH1697> that the king<WH4428> had commanded<WH6680>. So they left off speaking<WH2790> with him<WH1697>; for the matter was not perceived<WH8085>.
So Jeremiah<WH3414> lived<WH3427> in the court<WH2691> of the prison<WH4307> until the day<WH3117> that Jerusalem<WH3389> was taken<WH3920>: and he was there when Jerusalem<WH3389> was taken<WH3920>.
